website_summaries.verdict: Adidas decided to make Adipower 2 a step closer to a versatile CrossFit trainer by using a softer textile upper and a more flexible toe box. While many users enjoy the improved responsiveness, some still find themselves more comfortable wearing a stiffer and more solid shoe like Reebok Legacy Lifter.
pros: Users agree across the board that the shoe provides a solid and stable base for weightlifting exercises
Its elevated heel helps to improve ankle mobility and achieve deeper squats, according to many wearers
Some avid weightlifters enjoy the shoe’s flexible forefoot because it helps them get a better ground feedback
The new textile upper allows the toes to splay more easily in this model, which was lauded by the experts
Multiple buyers admire the new minimalist design of the trainer
cons: More than a few athletes think that the forefoot flexibility detracts from stability, especially for heavier lifts
One user complained that the eyelets snapped off after several times of use

customer_reviews.title: They snuggle feet all around. Not tight tight!
customer_reviews.text: I am a size 6 1/2 in US women's and got size 4.5 men. Absolutely love the colors! I use them for weightlifting and they are very supportive. I've gotten other 4.5 adidas weightlifting shoes in men's size and they're lose...these feel tighter but definitely better than having no support and lose. I'm sure with a few uses they will adjust!
customer_reviews.author: Dianna Barajas

customer_reviews.title: Great beginners lifting shoes.
customer_reviews.text: I have always wanted some power lifting shoes but they were always out of the price range. It was hard justifying spending so much money on an items when I am only a beginner and my Converse was doing what I need them to do (provide flat support). I came across these shoes which was within my budget and figured I would try them out. Great product! I have a better understanding for the need for Weight lifting specific shoes. While these shoes are not as flashy as the 200-300+ pairs, it does EXACTLY the same thing without breaking the bank. Great option especially for Flat footed people such as myself since these shoes do stretch a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Eblamo

customer_reviews.title: Great deal and work great as well  .
customer_reviews.text: My first pair of lifting shoes. I wear 13 and ordered size 13.5 because my feet are more wide and flat, and most reviews said go half a size up for wider feet. Also, the 13.5 was only $45 for a $200 shoe. However, I believe a 13 would have worked fine. I only squat in these and for that and the money the 13.5 works great. I had been squatting in an almost totally flat shoe prior to this. These are a great improvement .
customer_reviews.author: Kiki

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Does help during squatting. I do like Lestung better which I purchased together with this: it has a shape that fits better with my foot to be more snuggly.
customer_reviews.author: Quantitative Z

customer_reviews.title: Fit great
customer_reviews.text: These are my first pair of lifting shoes. But as an entry level lifter I can say without a doubt these are amazing. They fit perfect; nice and tight where they need to be and not too loose around my toes. These have helped me with my squat, snatch, and clean n' jerk. Helped with me holding posture while hitting the full depth. I'm 6'2", 190lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Wes

customer_reviews.title: Great fit and very comfy
customer_reviews.text: Perfect and arrived earlier. If you're a woman check the chart on Adidas' website. I'm a 7.5 and I got 6.5M and it was perfect
customer_reviews.author: Mariángel Febres

customer_reviews.title: Solid shoe with good looks to boot
customer_reviews.text: Great, stable shoe- fits as expected & looks great! All my gym friends were jealous when they saw them. I was lifting with a flat sole shoe before and these really helped me hit depth. Great grip with the floor.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Evans

customer_reviews.title: as good as any high end squat shoe
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for a friend. I have been using nike romaleos 2 and have always loved them. I tried the adipower 2 and think they are everybit as good as my Nike Romaleos 2. Highly recommend! Great Squat shoe!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome investment
customer_reviews.text: Perfect shoes for weight training. They really anchor you down when you are lifting. These have become a huge benefit when doing face pulls, squats, and deadlifts. My trainer went and bought a pair. Lol
customer_reviews.author: JonJonJonesy

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Great Product! I can't wait to go back to the gym!
customer_reviews.author: Fabian Badilla

customer_reviews.title: Great for starter shoes for squatting
customer_reviews.text: I'm new to the whole gym and fitness life style. I begin squatting in my regular pair of tennis shoes. Everyone told me I will get injury and my form is wrong. Thus, I've been searching for a squat shoes for weeks and this caught my eyes. It looks fantastic and work like it was designed for. Its comfortable enough to walk it, but definitely only would use it during workout. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: David Lee

customer_reviews.title: Good, but a bit narrow.
customer_reviews.text: The only negative is that it’s a bit narrow at the toes. I would like to have more room for my toes to spread out.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer
